subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Copernicus: The Priest Who Moved the Earth
description: One-minute skill: Copernicus: The Priest Who Moved the Earth.

hook.text: The man who said the Earth orbits the sun was a Catholic priest. Copernicus proves religion and science aren't enemies.

buildup.text: Nicolaus Copernicus was a canon in the Catholic Church. His heliocentric theory was published in 1543 as he was dying.

discovery.text: He dedicated his book to the Pope. The Church didn't ban it for 73 years. Initial reaction was curiosity, not outrage.

twist.text: Copernicus delayed publishing out of fear, but the fear was of ridicule by scientists, not punishment by the Church.

climax.text: The 'science vs. religion' story falls apart when you learn the scientific revolution was led by devout believers.

punchline.text: A priest moved the Earth around the sun. Faith and science coexisted.
